plyranges 1.1.4
  • Reference
  • Vignettes
    • Introduction to plyranges

Coerce an Rle or RleList object to Ranges

as_ranges.Rd

Coerce an Rle or RleList object to Ranges

as_ranges(.data)

Arguments

.data

a Rle() or an RleList() object.

Value

an IRanges() object if the input is an Rle() object or a GRanges() object for an RleList() object.

Details

This function is behind compute_coverage().

See also

S4Vectors::Rle(),IRanges::RleList()

Examples

x <- Rle(10:1, 1:10)
as_ranges(x)
#> IRanges object with 10 ranges and 1 metadata column:
#>            start       end     width |     score
#>        <integer> <integer> <integer> | <integer>
#>    [1]         1         1         1 |        10
#>    [2]         2         3         2 |         9
#>    [3]         4         6         3 |         8
#>    [4]         7        10         4 |         7
#>    [5]        11        15         5 |         6
#>    [6]        16        21         6 |         5
#>    [7]        22        28         7 |         4
#>    [8]        29        36         8 |         3
#>    [9]        37        45         9 |         2
#>   [10]        46        55        10 |         1

y <- RleList(x)
as_ranges(x)
#> IRanges object with 10 ranges and 1 metadata column:
#>            start       end     width |     score
#>        <integer> <integer> <integer> | <integer>
#>    [1]         1         1         1 |        10
#>    [2]         2         3         2 |         9
#>    [3]         4         6         3 |         8
#>    [4]         7        10         4 |         7
#>    [5]        11        15         5 |         6
#>    [6]        16        21         6 |         5
#>    [7]        22        28         7 |         4
#>    [8]        29        36         8 |         3
#>    [9]        37        45         9 |         2
#>   [10]        46        55        10 |         1
